sen.j: 北野大茶湯（きたのおおちゃのゆ）とは、天正15年10月1日 (旧暦)（グレゴリオ暦1587年11月1日）に京都北野天満宮境内において豊臣秀吉が主催した大規模な茶会のこと。
sen.e: The Kitano Grand Tea Ceremony on November 1, 1587 was organized by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in the grounds of Kitano Tenmangu Shrine large scale tea ceremony.
The Kitano Grand Tea Ceremony on November 1, 1587 organized by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI on the grounds of Kitano Tenmangu Shrine is a large scale tea ceremony.

sen.j: この年の7月に九州平定を終えた秀吉は、京都の朝廷や民衆に自己の権威を示すために、聚楽第造営と併行して大規模なイベントを開催することを企てた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi who had completed the subjugation of Kyushu in July of that year, aimed to hold the event coincided with the construction of his mansion "Jurakudai" to display his own power to the imperial court and general masses.

sen.j: 同月末より、諸大名・公家や京都・大坂・堺の茶人などに10月上旬に茶会を開く旨を通達した。
sen.e: From the end of the same month, various Daimyo (feudal lords), nobles and figures in the tea-ceremony circles in Osaka and Kyoto were informed that tea ceremonies would be held in early October. Following on from this, the following edict was posted on July 28 around Kyoto and other places.

sen.j: 北野の森において10月1日より10日間、大規模な茶会を開き、秀吉が自らの名物（茶道具）を数寄執心の者（名物マニア）に公開すること。
sen.e: In the woods of Kitano for 10 days from October 1, large-scale tea ceremonies were held where Hideyoshi's own tea ceremony treasures (tea ceremony related accessories) and his strong attachment to tea ceremony culture (infatuation with tea ceremony accessories) were on open show.

sen.j: 茶湯執心の者は若党、町人、百姓を問わない。
sen.e: Devotees of the culture of tea ceremony participated irrespective of whether they were foot soldiers, merchants or peasants. All used a kettle, bucket and drinking vessel; those with no tea utensils were permitted to substitute with other items the brought along.

sen.j: 座敷は北野の森の松原に畳2畳分を設置し、服装・履物・席次などは一切問わないものとする。
sen.e: Seating areas for the tea ceremony were made up of spaces where 2 tatami mats were placed in a pine grove in the Kitano forest. Clothing, footwear and social position had absolutely no bearing on events.

sen.j: 日本は言うまでもなく、数寄心がけのある者は唐国からでも参加すること。
sen.e: In Japan it went without saying that those with refined sensibilities came from China and Korea.

sen.j: 遠国からの者に配慮して10日まで開催することにしたこと。
sen.e: In consideration of those attending from distant parts, the events were held until the 10th.

sen.j: こうした配慮にも関わらず参加しない者は、今後茶湯を行ってはならない。
sen.e: In spite of such consideration, those who could not participate were unable to attend future tea ceremonies.

sen.j: 茶湯の心得がある者に対しては場所・出自を問わずに秀吉が目の前で茶を立てること。
sen.e: Hideyoshi prepared tea right in front of those with an understanding of the tea ceremony, regardless of whence they had come or their birth place.

sen.j: また秀吉は博多の豪商神谷宗湛にも参加を促す書状を送った。
sen.e: Also, Hideyoshi went as far to send a note encouraging the participation of Soutan KAMIYA, a wealthy merchant in Hakata.

sen.j: 実務面は前田玄以・宮城頼久らが行い、9月からは会場の工事も行われた。
sen.e: Geni MAEDA and Yorihisa MIYAGI handled practical matters and, attended to construction of the event site from September.

sen.j: 茶会初日である10月1日は、北野天満宮の拝殿（12畳分）を3つに区切り、その中央に黄金の茶室を持ち込んでその中に「似たり茄子」などの秀吉自慢の名物を陳列した。
sen.e: On October 1, the first day of the tea ceremony events, the front hall (12 tatami mats in area) of the Kitano Tenmangu Shrine was divided into 3 area, and into the middle space a gold tearoom was set in place and, within this space itself, Hideyoshi's own treasured tea ceremony utensils (such as the "Eggplant Resembling" porcelain) were displayed.

sen.j: 御触れの効果からか当日は京都だけではなく大坂・堺・奈良からも大勢の参加者が駆けつけ、総勢1,000人にも達した。
sen.e: Whether or not as a result of the edicts posted around town, on the day a mass of participants in the event came not only from Kyoto but from Osaka, Sakai and, Nara: total numbers reaching 1000.

sen.j: 4つの茶席には秀吉と千利休・津田宗及・今井宗久という当代きっての茶人3名を茶頭として迎えた。
sen.e: In 4 areas set aside for tea ceremonies, Hideyoshi and 3 preeminent contemporary masters of the tea ceremony (Sen no Rikyuu, Sogyu TSUDA and Sokyu IMAI) were in attendance. Irrespective of the rank of people attending the event, a lottery method was used to impartially select between 3 to 5 individuals to invite to participate in tea ceremonies where priceless tea ceremony utensils were used.

sen.j: 秀吉は午前中は茶頭として茶を振舞い、午後には会場内各所を満足げに視察して1日を過ごしたとされている。
sen.e: During the day, Hideyoshi spent the morning conducting tea ceremonies as leader of the ceremony. In the afternoons he satisfied himself by observing events in the various ceremony spaces.

sen.j: ところが、翌2日には一転して茶会は中止され、その後も再開されぬまま終了となった。
sen.e: However, 2 days later, things were completely changed and tea ceremonies halted. Subsequently as well, holding of ceremonies was not recommenced and the event was closed.

sen.j: これは1日の夕方に肥後国人一揆が発生したという知らせが入って秀吉が不快を覚えたからだという説が当時から囁かれており、今日でも通説とされている。
sen.e: It was rumored at the time (and is the common view to this day) that this was because on the evening of the first day news arrived of an uprising having broken out in Higo Province which is thought to have displeased Hideyoshi.

sen.j: しかし、このほかにも「秀吉の自己顕示欲が1日で満足した」とする見方や、「単なる専制君主特有の気まぐれである」とする見方もあり、真相は定かではない。
sen.e: However, besides this, there is a view that: Hideyoshi had satisfied his craving for the limelight in one day and, other views that: the event was a typical whim of an autocrat. Either way the truth is not clear.
